titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Raanan Geberer photographs of Brooklyn neighborhoods V1991.118
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T16:49-0500

did.unittitle: Raanan Geberer photographs of Brooklyn neighborhoods

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Raanan Geberer photographs of Brooklyn neighborhoods consist of 71 color photographic prints documenting various Brooklyn neighborhoods from 1988 to 1990, including Coney Island, Flatbush, Manhattan Beach, Midwood, Bay Ridge, and Brighton Beach, among others. The collection also includes numerous photographs showing areas within Prospect Park. All photographs are taken outdoors with the primary subjects being houses along Glenwood Road in Flatbush; street views of people on sidewalks; views taken from subway platforms; and people engaged in outdoor summertime activities. The photographer places some emphasis on documenting Jewish life in Brooklyn.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Raanan Geberer photographs of Brooklyn neighborhoods, V1991.118, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reproduction rights for the photographs have not been evaluated. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library. Please consult library staff for more information.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.
